title: Survival Radio Operating Procedures
brief: Maximize radio performance and battery life for emergency communications with rescue aircraft.
steps: Step 1: Transmit only in clear, unobstructed terrain - radios are line-of-sight devices.
Step 2: Keep antenna at right angles to rescuing aircraft - no signal comes from antenna tip.
Step 3: Never let antenna touch clothing, body, foliage, or ground - greatly reduces signal range.
Step 4: If radio has tone capability, place upright on flat, elevated surface.
Step 5: Conserve battery - turn off when not using, don't transmit constantly.
Step 6: In cold weather, keep battery inside clothing when not in use.
Step 7: Keep radio and battery dry - water destroys circuitry.
warnings: Extreme heat may cause battery to explode.
In hostile territory, keep transmissions short to avoid enemy direction finding.
Any terrain between radio and receiver blocks the signal.
